item.title: Watch live: SpaceX set for first manned private launch
item.description: With thunder threatening a delay, two Nasa astronauts made their way to the launch pad for the liftoff of a SpaceX rocket ship Wednesday on a history-making flight to the International Space Station that ...
item.author: newsfeeds@nzherald.co.nz

enclosure.url: https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202022/AP200528054402_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=NASA astronauts Douglas Hurley, left, and Robert Behnken ride a Tesla SUV from the Neil A. Armstrong Operations and Checkout Building on their way to Pad 39-A. AP Photo / John Raoux

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202022/AP200528053200_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Cars park in a vacant lot to watch the launch of SpaceX Falcon 9 with NASA astronauts Doug Hurley and Bob Behnken in the Dragon crew capsule. AP Photo / Charlie Riedel
